subject: Data
title: Hans Rosling: Making Data Come Alive
description: A quick win: understand Hans Rosling: Making Data Come Alive.

hook.text: A Swedish doctor stood on a TED stage and made statistics as exciting as a sports commentary.

buildup.text: Hans Rosling used animated bubble charts to show 200 years of global development in four minutes.

discovery.text: His tool, Gapminder, let audiences watch countries move from poverty to prosperity in real time.

twist.text: Rosling showed that most people's worldview was outdated â€” they thought the world was worse than data showed.

climax.text: His TED talks have been viewed over 35 million times, making him the world's most famous data presenter.

punchline.text: He turned boring statistics into standing ovations.

quiz.question: What tool did Hans Rosling create to visualize global development?
